quote_first: There was a most friendly parting, and when she sailed,

quote_last: . She left the office early, telling Dr. Van Vleet she felt she was coming down with something. Really it’s Nate who is coming down with something: he phones from his house, nasal, forlorn, he has to see her.
title: Life Before Man
author: Margaret Atwood

quote_last: every afternoon, the mother and son would appear at the beach. The mother always wore a plain light-colored dress with a broad-brimmed straw hat. The son never wore a hat; he had on sunglasses instead. They’d sit in the shade below the palm trees, the breeze rustling around them, and stare off at the ocean, not really doing anything.
title: Blind Willow, Sleeping Woman
author: Haruki Murakami

quote_last: by then, and the pavement was busy with shoppers.
